metadata.title: TSSA G3 Exam Questions
metadata.description: Complete question bank extracted from TSSA G3 Exam Simulator V3

questions.question: What do electrical drawings include?
options: Supply Voltage, Internal Wiring, Field Wiring, Location of controls
questions.correctAnswerText: Supply Voltage, Internal Wiring, Field Wiring, Location of controls

questions.question: What type of pressure is a gas line when no movement is taking place?
What is primary air?
options: The air that is mixed with gas prior to ignition
questions.correctAnswerText: The air that is mixed with gas prior to ignition

questions.question: What is the specific gravity of Propane?
What is the space ratio for converting propane from liquid to gas?
What section of the code is for Venting?
Who may refuse to grant the authorization or revoke, suspend, or refuse to renew an authorization, if the authorization holder is in contravention of this Act?
options: Minister of Consumer and Commercial Relations

questions.question: Who may only use force to enter and inspect a place where there is an immediate threat to public safety and only such force that is reasonably necessary in the circumstances?
Who shall order such investigation as he or she considers necessary on being notified of an accident or incident?
Every _______ shall take all reasonable precautions to ensure that they and their agents and employees comply with this Act, the regulations or a Ministers order
Who is the 'authority having jurisdiction' referenced in the Code for Ontario
An automatically controlled forced air furnace shall be equipped with a high temperature limit control, the maximum setting of the control shall be?
What is the maximum gas pressure allowed in a building under construction (construction heater application)?
A Notice of Proposal is not required to be provided by TSSA when?
options: When certification is being suspended due to negligence
When suspending a certification due to failure to pay certification fees
questions.correctAnswerText: When suspending a certification due to failure to pay certification fees

questions.question: Which certification agency listed is not certified for appliance approvals in Ontario?
Welded gas piping must comply with?
A Technician not agreeing with a Directors ruling may?
options: Continue performing duties as a Gas Technician
Appeal to the Director of Fuels Safety at TSSA
Appeal to the Director of TSSA
Appeal to the Ontario Divisional Court
questions.correctAnswerText: Appeal to the Ontario Divisional Court

questions.question: A person might be refused authorization where?
options: The person resides in another Province or Territory
The person resides in another country
The person is qualified in another Province or Territory

questions.question: A Safety Order can be given?
options: Only after a hearing has taken place
Only after prior notice has been given

questions.question: No person shall remove a seal affixed by an Inspector:
options: Without consent from the Director of Fuel Safety TSSA
Without the consent of the Distributor
Without the consent of the TSSA Fuel Safety Inspector who affixed the seal
questions.correctAnswerText: Without the consent of the TSSA Fuel Safety Inspector who affixed the seal

questions.question: The maximum fine for contravention of the Acts and Regulations for an individual is?
A Hydrocarbon is defined as?
options: Chemical compound of Hydro electricity and Water
Chemical compound of Hydrogen and Carbon Dioxide
Chemical compound of Hydrogen and Carbon Monoxide
Chemical compound of Hydrogen and Carbon
questions.correctAnswerText: Chemical compound of Hydrogen and Carbon

questions.question: Who has the responsibility under the Act of Inspecting and Accepting an Installation before supplying gas for the first time?
No person shall operate a container refill center unless?
options: The operator of the refill center posts a personal bond of $500,000
The refill center is located more than 0.5 kilometres from a residential area
The refill center is insured for $2,000,000 liability

questions.question: An 'indirect fired appliance' is defined as?
options: An appliance in which the flue gases are not mixed with the medium being heated
An appliance in which the flue gases are intermixed with the medium being heated
An appliance with all combustion air supplied directly from, and all combustion products directly vented to the outdoors by independent enclosed passageways connected directly to the appliance
An appliance with storage capability only, and where heat is transferred from one heating medium to another
questions.correctAnswerText: An appliance in which the flue gases are not mixed with the medium being heated

questions.question: What is a directive in the context of workplace safety legislation?
options: Directive focusing on specific safety areas under an act
questions.correctAnswerText: Directive focusing on specific safety areas under an act

questions.question: What is one primary duty of a gas technician when finding a gas appliance in immediate hazard condition?
options: Tag the appliance and continue use
Shut off the gas supply and notify the user and distributor
Inform a co-worker and resume work
questions.correctAnswerText: Shut off the gas supply and notify the user and distributor

questions.question: How soon must a gas technician provide written notice to the distributor about an immediate hazard?
What should be done if an appliance is found in unacceptable condition but not an immediate hazard?
options: Shut off gas and discard appliance
Notify distributor and user with written notice
questions.correctAnswerText: Notify distributor and user with written notice

questions.question: Why is it important to study local OH&S acts and regulations?
options: To understand and comply with specific workplace safety requirements
questions.correctAnswerText: To understand and comply with specific workplace safety requirements

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically found in OH&S acts?
What is one key component of hazard reporting procedures?
options: Report hazards within a specific time frame
Keep a personal record for yourself
questions.correctAnswerText: Report hazards within a specific time frame

questions.question: If unsure about reporting requirements, a worker should:
options: Ask the supervisor or consult the WCB
questions.correctAnswerText: Ask the supervisor or consult the WCB

questions.question: What does WCB stand for?
Which document must be filed when a worker is injured and misses work?
Who fills out the WCB report form?
How does an act differ from a regulation?
options: Acts are legal frameworks; regulations are specific directives under acts
questions.correctAnswerText: Acts are legal frameworks; regulations are specific directives under acts

questions.question: If a gas technician gives oral notice about a hazard, they must also:
options: Write a notice to the user and distributor
questions.correctAnswerText: Write a notice to the user and distributor

questions.question: What does the CSA encourage workers to do with their province's OH&S acts?
What is one way to keep up to date with regulations?
What kind of condition requires immediate gas shutoff and notice?
When must a gas technician notify the user about a hazardous condition?
Which of the following are typical sections in a provincial OH&S act?
options: Duties of workers and employers, toxic substances, penalties
questions.correctAnswerText: Duties of workers and employers, toxic substances, penalties

questions.question: The role of safety regulations under energy or fuel acts includes:
options: Ensuring safe installation and operation of gas equipment
questions.correctAnswerText: Ensuring safe installation and operation of gas equipment

questions.question: What system provides vital information about hazardous materials in the workplace?
WHMIS 2015 aligns with which international system?
What document replaced MSDS under WHMIS 2015?
Under WHMIS 2015, what does the signal word "Danger" indicate?
What are the two main hazard groups under GHS?
What symbol indicates acute toxicity or a serious health hazard?
Who is responsible for ensuring SDS are accessible at the workplace?
A workplace label is required when:
options: Product is shipped directly from supplier
Product is transferred to another container
Product is labeled in another language
questions.correctAnswerText: Product is transferred to another container

questions.question: What does SDS Section 1 provide?
Which of the following is not a route of entry for solvents?
How should solvent spills be cleaned?
options: Absorbed with sawdust and left out
Immediately cleaned and rags stored properly
questions.correctAnswerText: Immediately cleaned and rags stored properly

questions.question: What is the purpose of grounding drums with flammable liquids?
What is a proper precaution when using solvents?
What PPE is recommended for inhalation hazards?
What material emits highly toxic fumes when burned?
Which form of chlorine is heavier than air and collects near the ground?
What is the first step if a chlorine leak is suspected?
What hazard is associated with cutting galvanized pipes?
What gas is heavier than air and collects at low points?
What colour is gaseous chlorine?
What should you do if a container label becomes unreadable?
options: Pour it into a clear bottle

questions.question: What toxic material is found in plastic venting glues?
What is the recommended method for transporting propane cylinders?
What does the biohazard pictogram represent?
What gases are typically found in sewer gas?
What is the safe response to suspected sewer gas in a manhole?
What should be clearly labeled on solvent containers?
Asbestos must be:
options: Handled only after certified training and permission
questions.correctAnswerText: Handled only after certified training and permission

questions.question: What is the flammable range of gasoline vapours?
Why is an odourant added to natural gas and propane?
What is the most common fire hazard in HVAC work?
Which class of fire extinguisher is used for electrical fires?
Before working on an HVAC system, what should always be done first?
What is the fire triangle composed of?
What is the primary fire risk when handling refrigerants?
options: Refrigerant combustion or explosion in confined space
questions.correctAnswerText: Refrigerant combustion or explosion in confined space

questions.question: What type of PPE is critical when soldering or brazing near flammable materials?
How should flammable solvents be stored?
options: In sealed, approved safety containers away from ignition sources
questions.correctAnswerText: In sealed, approved safety containers away from ignition sources

questions.question: What should be used to test for gas leaks in a line?
options: Soapy water or approved gas detector
questions.correctAnswerText: Soapy water or approved gas detector

questions.question: What is the minimum fire extinguisher rating recommended on an HVAC service truck?
Which HVAC process presents the greatest risk of igniting flammable vapors?
Why should gas-fired equipment be properly vented?
options: To remove combustion by-products and reduce fire risk
questions.correctAnswerText: To remove combustion by-products and reduce fire risk

questions.question: If a fire starts in a ceiling space, what is the first thing an HVAC technician should do?
options: Activate the nearest fire alarm and evacuate
questions.correctAnswerText: Activate the nearest fire alarm and evacuate

questions.question: What is a key responsibility of an HVAC tech when working in areas with combustible dust?
options: Eliminate ignition sources and use spark-proof tools
Use a leaf blower to remove it
questions.correctAnswerText: Eliminate ignition sources and use spark-proof tools

questions.question: What is the purpose of a fire damper in HVAC ductwork?
options: Stop the spread of fire and smoke
questions.correctAnswerText: Stop the spread of fire and smoke

questions.question: When using torches, what safety check should be done first?
options: Inspect hoses and connections for leaks
questions.correctAnswerText: Inspect hoses and connections for leaks

questions.question: Which standard outlines fire safety procedures for HVAC installations in Canada?
Combustible materials should be kept at least how far from ignition sources?
What should be done with oily rags after use?
options: Store in a metal container with a self-closing lid
questions.correctAnswerText: Store in a metal container with a self-closing lid

questions.question: What condition can create a backdraft when opening a furnace room door during a fire?
options: Oxygen rushing into an oxygen-deprived fire
questions.correctAnswerText: Oxygen rushing into an oxygen-deprived fire

questions.question: After extinguishing a small HVAC-related fire, what should the technician do next?
options: Report the incident and inspect for hidden fires
questions.correctAnswerText: Report the incident and inspect for hidden fires

questions.question: What is the total resistance of a 3 resistors in parallel, one 20 ohm, one 30 ohm, one 40 ohm?
What is the total resistance of a 3 resistors in series, one 10 ohm, one 15 ohm, one 20 ohm?
If voltage remains constant and resistance doubles, what happens to the amperage?
If amperage remains constant and resistance doubles, what happens to the voltage?
If resistance remains constant and voltage doubles, what happens to the amperage?
When the gauge number of the wire increases the resistance?
The highest amperage would flow through a
Who may remove a lock used to lockout a piece of equipment?
options: The technician that placed the lock or supervisor
questions.correctAnswerText: The technician that placed the lock or supervisor

questions.question: Of what three particles are atoms made?
What are the laws of electric charge?
options: Unlike charges repel and like charges attract
Like charges attract and unlike charges attract
Like charges repel and unlike charges attract
Unlike charges repel and like charges repel
questions.correctAnswerText: Like charges repel and unlike charges attract

questions.question: Which of the following is not a good conductor?
What makes a good insulator?
options: materials that have the ability to allow current flow easily
materials that have the ability to resist current flow
questions.correctAnswerText: materials that have the ability to resist current flow

questions.question: When is an atom considered to be electrically neutral?
options: when the number of electrons is equal to the number of protons
when the number of electrons is equal to the number of neutrons
when there are more electrons than protons
when there are more protons than electrons
questions.correctAnswerText: when the number of electrons is equal to the number of protons

questions.question: When is an atom considered to be positively charged?
options: when the number of electrons is equal to the number of protons
when the number of electrons is equal to the number of neutrons
when there are more electrons than protons
when there are more protons than electrons
questions.correctAnswerText: when there are more protons than electrons

questions.question: When is an atom considered to be negatively charged?
options: when the number of electrons is equal to the number of protons
when the number of electrons is equal to the number of neutrons
when there are more electrons than protons
when there are more protons than electrons
questions.correctAnswerText: when there are more electrons than protons

questions.question: In a series circuit which of the following remains constant?
In a parallel circuit which of the following remains constant?
What are the two types of current?
What is the proper test pressure and duration for a gas piping system with 150' longest measured run with a system supply pressure of 7" water column?
When an appliance is converted from one gas to another what must the installer do?
options: Mark the new type of gas being used on the rating plate
questions.correctAnswerText: Mark the new type of gas being used on the rating plate

questions.question: Plastic piping and tubing may currently only be used for?
options: Gas supply piping inside a residence only

questions.question: Which of the following appliances must have a dirt pocket installed on them?
Piping installed underground cannot be less than ____" in diameter
Which of the following fittings cannot be used on a gas piping system?
The B149.1 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code does not apply to:
options: Appliances installed in a commercial building
Propane supply piping from the distributors tank to the second stage regulator
Utility pipeline distribution or transmission lines
questions.correctAnswerText: Utility pipeline distribution or transmission lines

questions.question: When installing gas burning appliances in a mobile home what Code applies?
A Category 4 appliance is:
options: An appliance that operates with a positive vent static pressure, and with a flue loss less than 17%
An appliance that operates with a non-positive vent static pressure, and with a flue loss not less than 17%
An appliance that operates with a non-positive vent static pressure and with a flue loss less than 17%
An appliance that operates with a positive vent static pressure and with a flue loss not less than 17%
questions.correctAnswerText: An appliance that operates with a positive vent static pressure, and with a flue loss less than 17%

questions.question: Which type of draft is produced by a device upstream of the appliance combustion zone?
A 'quick disconnect' device is?
options: An emergency shut off to control all gas supplied to the building
A solenoid that is fast closing
A flare nut type fitting on a gas line
A hand operated device providing connection and disconnection means for an appliance to the gas supply
questions.correctAnswerText: A hand operated device providing connection and disconnection means for an appliance to the gas supply

questions.question: Where is the fan located in the 'forced draft burner' appliance?
Where is the fan located in the 'induced draft burner' appliance?
The statement that best describes a continuous pilot is?
options: The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and remains lit during the entire call for heat.
The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and cuts off at the end of the main burner proving period.
The pilot is on all the time, on a call for heat the pilot expands in size to reliably light burner
The pilot is on all the time, and remains the same size
questions.correctAnswerText: The pilot is on all the time, and remains the same size

questions.question: The statement that best describes an intermittent pilot is?
options: The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and remains lit during the entire call for heat.
The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and cuts off at the end of the main burner proving period.
The pilot is on all the time, on a call for heat the pilot expands in size to reliably light the burner.
The pilot is on all the time and remains the same size.
questions.correctAnswerText: The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and remains lit during the entire call for heat.

questions.question: The statement that best describes an interrupted pilot is?
options: The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and remains lit during the entire call for heat.
The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and cuts off at the end of the main burner proving period.
The pilot is on all the time, on a call for heat the pilot expands in size to reliably light the burner.
The pilot is on all the time and remains the same size
questions.correctAnswerText: The pilot is lit each time there is a call for heat, and cuts off at the end of the main burner proving period.

questions.question: Air supply for central furnaces 400,000 Btu/hr and below shall be provided in accordance with?
options: Annex F of the B149.1 Code

questions.question: What must be done if a defective heat exchanger is found in a dwelling unit?
options: It may be welded, if welder is certified
If defects do not affect the flame, nothing has to be done
If carbon monoxide is not present nothing has to be done

questions.question: What is the maximum gas pressure allowed in a commercial building's central boiler room?
What type of vent is to be used on a wall furnace when the vent is concealed?
When a unit heater is installed in a garage the minimum clearance of ____' shall be maintained between the base of the heater and the floor (when the heater has no guard)
If a furnace is installed in a repair garage, any component capable of igniting flammable vapour must be located _____" above the floor
What is the maximum gas pressure allowed inside a one family dwelling?
Tubing installed in hollow walls or partitions must be protected from physical damage with # ____ GSG plates or sleeves
A water heater installed in a bathroom shall be?
A chimney shall not extend less than ____' above the highest point where it passes through the roof of a building
A moisture exhaust duct must terminate at least ____ feet from a service regulator
A room heater installed in a bathroom shall be?
An air supply inlet to a building must be located at least ____" above outside grade level
A vent connector serving an appliance without flue gas dilution air must be made of # _____ GSG galvanized steel.
When a common gas vent is used it shall be?
A pool heating appliance installed outdoors at grade level shall be placed on a base of poured concrete or reinforced concrete slab, extending at least?
options: 6" beyond all sides of the appliance
3" beyond all sides of the appliance
1" beyond all sides of the appliance
12" beyond all sides of the appliance
questions.correctAnswerText: 6" beyond all sides of the appliance

questions.question: What is the minimum clearance to combustibles on a commercial type clothes dryer?
A light used for searching for gas leakage shall be:
When using a gauge to perform pressure testing of a gas piping system, the gauge shall be:
options: 2" in diameter, maximum range of shall exceed the test pressure by at least 15% but not more than 300%.
3" in diameter, maximum range of shall exceed the test pressure by at least 15% but not more than 300%
3" in diameter, maximum range of test pressure shall not exceed the test pressure by at least 15% but not more than 200%
3" in diameter, reading in 1 PSI increments.
questions.correctAnswerText: 3" in diameter, maximum range of shall exceed the test pressure by at least 15% but not more than 300%

questions.question: What table would be used to calculate combustion air sizing for appliances having draft control devices, when the combined input is up to and including 400,000 Btu, and the structure does not comply with clause 8.2.1 (a) or (b).
When a vent connector from a category 1 appliance passes through an unheated space, what must be done to the vent connector?
options: The connector must be Type C "heavy wall"
The connector must be Type B
The connector must be type BW

questions.question: What must be provided when a hose is used to transfer liquid propane from one container to another?
Meter and service regulator installations shall be made in accordance with:
What is the minimum distance a gas service regulator outlet must terminate from an appliance vent?
How much pressure drop is allowed for a natural gas tubing system (using copper), when using 5 PSI supply pressure?
An intermittent pilot is:
options: A pilot that is lit each time there is a call for heat and that burns during the entire period the main burner is firing
A pilot that is lit each time there is a call for heat and that is cut off automatically at the end of the trial for ignition period of the main burner.
A pilot that burns without turndown throughout the entire time the burner is in service, whether the main burner is firing or not
A pilot flame supervised by a primary safety control that senses the presence of the pilot prior to gas being admitted to the main burner
questions.correctAnswerText: A pilot that is lit each time there is a call for heat and that burns during the entire period the main burner is firing

questions.question: Who is responsible for ensuring that the manufacturers installation instructions are left with the end user?
What is the ignition temperature of propane?
What is secondary air?
options: Air that is mixed and added at the point of combustion and surrounds the flame
questions.correctAnswerText: Air that is mixed and added at the point of combustion and surrounds the flame

questions.question: What is the flame temperature of natural gas?
What is the lower explosive limit (LEL) of natural gas?
What is the composition of air?
What are the symptoms of Carbon Monoxide Poisoning?
options: Headache, dizziness, fatigue, nausea and death
questions.correctAnswerText: Headache, dizziness, fatigue, nausea and death

questions.question: How many PPM does it take to start noticing symptoms of carbon monoxide?
Natural gas has what % of methane?
What is the barometric pressure at sea level?
What is the chemical structure of propane?
The rating of Gas appliances is in what units?
Most natural gas burners produce CO in what range?
What is the specific gravity of natural gas?
When measuring pipe/piping you go by what?
When measuring tube/tubing you go by?
When temperature of any substance increases, its pressure will?
Convert 35 degree Celsius to Fahrenheit:
Which of the following methods is used to project a professional attitude?
options: Give easily understood explanations of problems
questions.correctAnswerText: Give easily understood explanations of problems

questions.question: Why is a neat, well-groomed appearance important when dealing with a customer?
options: It indicates to a customer that your work will reflect the same care and consideration
It indicates to a customer that you are a supervisor
It represents the values of the company to the customer
questions.correctAnswerText: It indicates to a customer that your work will reflect the same care and consideration

questions.question: What should be done before using water, power etc., in a customer's home?
options: Check the source for any safety issues and report
Advise the customer you cannot complete the work unless you have access to the utilities

questions.question: What should be done after hearing the customer's explanation of a problem or request?
options: Tell the customer you are the expert and you will figure it out for yourself
Advise the customer they should learn how to operate the equipment properly
Clarify by recapping or paraphrasing the customer's explanation to assure them that they have communicated it accurately to you
questions.correctAnswerText: Clarify by recapping or paraphrasing the customer's explanation to assure them that they have communicated it accurately to you

questions.question: Why is asking the right question in the right way important when dealing with customer concerns?
options: It can shorten the time it takes to analyze the problem and will save them money
It can not only help to isolate the problem, but it can also make the customer feel he/she is part of the process
It can prevent you from having to go back to the vehicle to get extra tools
questions.correctAnswerText: It can not only help to isolate the problem, but it can also make the customer feel he/she is part of the process

questions.question: After solving a service problem, what should be done to allay further concerns of the customer?
options: The customer should be advised how the last person who worked on the system was incompetent
The customer should be advised to read the instructions that came with the appliance and try and fix it first before calling
A brief explanation of the problem and its solution should be given to the customer
questions.correctAnswerText: A brief explanation of the problem and its solution should be given to the customer

questions.question: What is a good way to ensure your footwear is clean and dry when entering a customer's home?
options: Bring an extra pair of shoes for inside
Wipe your shoes on the customers doormat

questions.question: Where should you park your service vehicle when arriving at a customer's location?
options: Both the street and driveway are acceptable
questions.correctAnswerText: Both the street and driveway are acceptable

questions.question: What electrical appliance(s) should never be unplugged in order to obtain power?
options: Any appliance connected with an extension cord

questions.question: What should be done before moving an appliance into a customer's home?
options: Take measurements to ensure it can fit in the space provided
Ask the customer to leave and they will see the appliance after it is installed
Ask the customer if they know if the appliance will fit in the space provided
questions.correctAnswerText: Take measurements to ensure it can fit in the space provided

questions.question: What should be done if a customer's property is damaged?
options: Assess the damage and touch up any small marks before the customer has an opportunity to see it
Immediately report all damage to the customer and your supervisor
Advise the customer the damage was there before you started
questions.correctAnswerText: Immediately report all damage to the customer and your supervisor

questions.question: What should be done after a customer's problem has been solved and the work is complete?
options: Produce an invoice for the work and demand payment
Perform a follow-up to ensure the customer is still satisfied
questions.correctAnswerText: Perform a follow-up to ensure the customer is still satisfied

questions.question: Which of the following is a better choice of words than, "I know how you feel," when responding to a customer's complaint?
options: I can understand why you feel that way
questions.correctAnswerText: I can understand why you feel that way

questions.question: Which is the better choice of words than, "You are not making any sense" when responding to a customer's concerns?
options: Maybe I am not understanding you correctly
questions.correctAnswerText: Maybe I am not understanding you correctly

questions.question: What is the best policy regarding arguments with a customer?
options: Listen, but make sure the customer agrees with you by the end
Advise the customer you are the expert
Avoiding arguments is the best policy
questions.correctAnswerText: Avoiding arguments is the best policy

questions.question: Which of the following non-verbal communication techniques can be used to diffuse a customer's anger?
options: Facial expression (calm, sincere, concerned, interested expression)
Turn your back to the customer
Say nothing and leave without fixing the problem
questions.correctAnswerText: Facial expression (calm, sincere, concerned, interested expression)

questions.question: What is an appropriate response to a customer who is demanding something unreasonable or impossible?
options: Calmly leave the location and mark it on the work order
Calmly and patiently tell them what you are able to do, not what you cannot do
questions.correctAnswerText: Calmly and patiently tell them what you are able to do, not what you cannot do

questions.question: What is a poor response when dealing with a rude customer?
options: Do you want this fixed or not?
What would you like me to do to solve the problem you are having?
I am not meeting your expectations. What can I do?
questions.correctAnswerText: Do you want this fixed or not?

questions.question: What is a good response to an abusive customer?
options: You are rude, and I do not have to take this abuse, I am leaving
Say nothing, turn around and leave
I am sorry, but if you cannot speak to me on a professional basis, I will have to leave
questions.correctAnswerText: I am sorry, but if you cannot speak to me on a professional basis, I will have to leave

questions.question: What should you do when a customer becomes unruly or threatening?
options: Seek assistance. If violence is threatened, call the police
Shut off the fuel supply and mark the work order that the system has been tagged
Lock the meter or shut off the fuel supply and lock it
questions.correctAnswerText: Seek assistance. If violence is threatened, call the police

questions.question: Which is the better way of communicating with a person who speaks little English?
What is a possible alternative to speaking when you are trying to communicate with a customer who has heavily accented English?
options: Advise the customer someone else will attend
Have the customer try to write his/her request
questions.correctAnswerText: Have the customer try to write his/her request

questions.question: How may cultural differences affect work schedules?
options: Someone who is of the same background would have to attend
Cultural differences don't affect work schedules
Work may have to be scheduled around religious or cultural practices
questions.correctAnswerText: Work may have to be scheduled around religious or cultural practices

questions.question: Cement can have an adverse effect on gas piping and tubing.
What is necessary for corrosion to occur?
What is an example of the benefit of electrochemical action?
Which is a better electrolyte?
In which direction will the electrical current flow if an electrolyte is placed between two metals of differing potential?
options: From the higher potential metal to a lower potential metal
From the lower potential metal to a higher potential metal
questions.correctAnswerText: From the higher potential metal to a lower potential metal

questions.question: When installed underground, which type of copper tubing does not require a protective coating?
How is an underground steel piping system isolated from the above-ground piping to which it is connected?
options: By the use of dielectric fittings
questions.correctAnswerText: By the use of dielectric fittings

questions.question: What are the three most common materials used for water distribution piping?
options: Copper, galvanized steel, asbestos cement pipe

questions.question: What is the colour code for Type K copper?
May polybutylene be used on both hot and cold-water distribution lines?
What is the melting temperature of hard solders?
Can the solvent cement specified for use with one type of plastic pipe be used with another type of plastic pipe?
options: Yes, as long as it has a complete bead

questions.question: One method of measuring pipe length is to measure the pipe from end to centre.
Are fitting allowances for a specific diameter and type of fitting the same for all manufacturers?
Which of the following piping materials cannot be used in gas piping systems?
Steel or malleable iron fittings may be used with steel pipe.
You cannot use type ________ copper tubing in gas systems, as its wall thickness is slightly less than that of type G tubing.
How shall piping be sized?
options: To meet the volume and pressure requirements at the point of use
To meet the pressure requirements at the point of use
To meet the volume requirements at the point of use
According to the appliance manufacturers installation manual
questions.correctAnswerText: To meet the volume and pressure requirements at the point of use

questions.question: What is the maximum allowable pressure drop on a piping system that has a natural gas supply pressure of 7 in w.c. to 14 in w.c.?
How shall the gas pressure requirements for an appliance be determined?
options: Appliance rating plate or from the appliance manufacturer
questions.correctAnswerText: Appliance rating plate or from the appliance manufacturer

questions.question: How shall an extension of an existing piping or tubing system be sized?
options: Sized to meet the load demand of the extended piping system
Sized to meet the requirements of Clause 6.3 of CSA B149.1
Sized to meet the requirements of Clause 5.2 of CSA Z662
questions.correctAnswerText: Sized to meet the requirements of Clause 6.3 of CSA B149.1

questions.question: What is the maximum pressure drop allowed on a piping system that has a natural gas supply pressure less than 7 in w.c.?
How shall the volume of gas to an appliance be determined?
options: From either the rating plate or the appliance manufacturer
By the size of the piping system the appliance is connected to
questions.correctAnswerText: From either the rating plate or the appliance manufacturer

questions.question: Must the ends of all piping be reamed?
What is the maximum spacing of supports for 1 in horizontal piping?
What diameters of piping require welded joints?
May a copper joint be made with brazing material that has a melting temperature exceeding 1000°F (537 °C)?
During a period when a piping outlet to an appliance is not connected to the appliance, how shall it be made tight?
options: A piping outlet must always be connected to an appliance
By means of a plugged valve or either a cap or plug made of a material compatible with the piping or tubing system
questions.correctAnswerText: By means of a plugged valve or either a cap or plug made of a material compatible with the piping or tubing system

questions.question: A ________ is an area in a piping system that collects condensate and from which you can remove the condensate.
What is the minimum diameter of piping that can be installed underground?
How shall the gas supply to an underground plastic pipe or tubing be controlled?
options: By a shut-off valve situated above ground
questions.correctAnswerText: By a shut-off valve situated above ground

questions.question: May a vented appliance be connected with a hose?
May a connector be used to connect a mobile home?
options: Yes, where the mobile home is not on a permanent foundation
questions.correctAnswerText: Yes, where the mobile home is not on a permanent foundation

questions.question: What are the pressure test requirements for a 250 ft (76 m) natural gas piping system with a working pressure of 2 psig?
What are the minimum test requirements for all wrapped or factory-coated piping?
options: 100 psig and within the time duration required of Table 6.3, Note 2
questions.correctAnswerText: 100 psig and within the time duration required of Table 6.3, Note 2

questions.question: May rooftop piping be supported with treated wood blocks?
May plastic pipe be used on liquid propane system?
When may piping less than NPS 1/2 be used indoors?
options: On a propane branch line not exceeding 15 ft in length
On a propane branch line not exceeding 25 ft in length
Piping less than NPS 1/2 cannot be used indoors
questions.correctAnswerText: On a propane branch line not exceeding 25 ft in length

questions.question: May propane piping or tubing be supported by other piping or tubing?
options: Yes, providing the piping is less than NPS ¾

questions.question: What is the required diameter of a dirt pocket used on propane systems?
options: The diameter shall be NPS 2 or equal to the diameter it serves whichever is the lesser
The diameter shall be NPS 2 or equal to the diameter it serves whichever is the greater
questions.correctAnswerText: The diameter shall be NPS 2 or equal to the diameter it serves whichever is the lesser

questions.question: May a close nipple be used on a propane piping system?
When tubing runs horizontally across studs notched to accommodate the tubing, it must be protected where it crosses each stud by a ________.
What is the maximum interval that propane tubing can be run inside a residential occupancy without identification?
Where must the shut-off valves be placed if propane piping or tubing is extended from one building to another?
options: At the exit of the first building
At the point of entry to the second building
One at the exit of the first building and another at the point of entry to the second building
questions.correctAnswerText: One at the exit of the first building and another at the point of entry to the second building

questions.question: What is the required test pressure of a propane piping system 50 ft long with a working pressure of 10 psig?
Is an individual shut-off valve required for all propane appliances on a recreational vehicle?
When during a piping installation should pressure testing be carried out?
options: After all of the appliances have been installed and connected
Before any appliance is installed. A leak test is required after the appliance is installed
questions.correctAnswerText: Before any appliance is installed. A leak test is required after the appliance is installed

questions.question: What is the minimum diameter gauge that can be used for pressure testing?
What two inert gases may be used to pressure-test gas piping systems?
What should be done immediately after opening the gas valve at the gas meter?
options: Listen for the gas flow to stop and monitor the gas meter test dial
Test fire the gas appliance and check the input
Ventilate by opening a window allowing any gas to escape during the purging process
questions.correctAnswerText: Listen for the gas flow to stop and monitor the gas meter test dial

questions.question: How can a leak be located?
options: By providing a lit taper at each joint and looking for a small flame
By watching the meter for movement
By wiping each joint in the system with a leak detecting solution (i.e., soap and water)
questions.correctAnswerText: By wiping each joint in the system with a leak detecting solution (i.e., soap and water)

questions.question: What personal information must the gas technician/fitter place on the test tag after testing is complete?
options: Name, address and phone number of gas technician

questions.question: Which appliance piping should be purged first?
options: The one with the largest input
The one farthest from the point of supply
The one with the smallest input
questions.correctAnswerText: The one farthest from the point of supply

questions.question: What type of gas cock must be placed within 5 ft of the purge point?
options: One with ¼ turn lever handle
questions.correctAnswerText: One with ¼ turn lever handle

questions.question: What substance is used to purge the air out of a gas piping system that is 4 in diameter or larger?
options: An inert gas (carbon dioxide or nitrogen)
questions.correctAnswerText: An inert gas (carbon dioxide or nitrogen)

questions.question: What is the maximum input of a propane appliance that may be purged at the pilot outlet of the appliance control valve?
What characteristics of propane differentiate propane purging from natural gas purging?
The approximate explosive range of natural gas is ________ to ________ natural gas in air.
The approximate explosive limits of propane gas range from ________ to ________ propane in air.
Natural gas is heavier than air.
Air is lighter than propane.
What is acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction?
What is a primarily vertical shaft that encloses at least one flue for conducting flue gases outdoors?

What is an appliance constructed so that all the combustion air is supplied directly from, and the products of combustion are vented directly to, the outdoors by independent enclosed passageways connected directly to the appliance?
What is a device, either adjustable or non-adjustable, for controlling and maintaining, within acceptable limits, a uniform outlet pressure?
True or False: A venting system removes flue gases to the outdoors by means of a chimney, vent connector vent, or a natural or mechanical exhaust system.
Which of the following describes a continuous pilot?
options: A pilot that is automatically lighted each time there is a call for heat, and that is cut off automatically at the end of the trial-for-ignition period of the main burner
A pilot that burns without turndown throughout the entire time the burner is in service, whether the main burner is firing or not
A pilot that is automatically lighted each time there is a call for heat, and that burns during the entire period that the main burner is firing
questions.correctAnswerText: A pilot that burns without turndown throughout the entire time the burner is in service, whether the main burner is firing or not

questions.question: True or False: An enclosed structure is the entire building in which an appliance is installed.
What type of burner is not equipped with a mechanical device for supplying combustion air?
What is the maximum gas pressure permitted inside one- and two-family dwellings and row housing?
What is the maximum gas pressure permitted inside commercial buildings?
Where can you determine the volume of gas to be used for sizing pipe systems to an appliance?
options: The appliance rating plate or the appliance manufacturer
questions.correctAnswerText: The appliance rating plate or the appliance manufacturer

questions.question: According to Table 6.1, what is the maximum allowable pressure drop when a natural gas piping and tubing system supply pressure is less than 7 inches w.c.?
options: There is no maximum allowable pressure drop

questions.question: Can a gas pipe be supported by another gas pipe?
options: Yes, if it is a smaller diameter
Yes, if it is a larger diameter

questions.question: What is the minimum depth of cover required on an underground gas line for residential installations?
What is the minimum depth of cover required on an underground gas line for commercial driveways?
Can gas piping be passed under a building?
options: Yes, if it is at least 24 inches (610 mm) below the footings
Yes, if it is at least 15 inches (400 mm) below the footings

questions.question: When piping is extended from one building to another, where must the shut-off valves be located?
options: At the point of exit of the first building and the point of entry of the second building
questions.correctAnswerText: At the point of exit of the first building and the point of entry of the second building

questions.question: What is the minimum clearance required for each side of a commercial clothes dryer and the combustible material?
What is the minimum clearance required above a central furnace?
What is the minimum clearance required at the front of a central furnace?
What type of room heater is allowed in a bathroom?
What is the minimum clearance required at the front of a swimming pool heater?
How far from a property line must a natural gas cylinder be stored if the aggregate capacity of the expanded gas exceeds 18,000 cubic feet (500,000 L)?
May a vehicle that is being refuelled with natural gas have its engine running?
options: Yes, provided it is 25 feet from a building

questions.question: Who may transfer propane from one container to another?
options: Anyone as long as they stay in attendance at the transfer point
The holder of a certificate recognized by the authority having jurisdiction
A person trained by the employer on the operation of the equipment
questions.correctAnswerText: The holder of a certificate recognized by the authority having jurisdiction

questions.question: What is the maximum permitted filling density of a propane cylinder?
In which tables of the Propane Storage and Handling Code can the maximum filling density of a propane tank be found?
May a building that has a propane vaporizer be permitted to have a drain to a sewer or a sump pit?
options: Yes, provided it has a removable cap

questions.question: Propane-burning appliances installed in a mobile home must comply with which standard?
What are the installer's responsibilities towards the user before he or she leaves an installation?
options: Shall instruct the user in the safe and correct operation of all appliances or equipment installed
Shall advise the user the instructions have been left with the appliance
Shall instruct the user to read the manufacturers literature while the installation is being completed
questions.correctAnswerText: Shall instruct the user in the safe and correct operation of all appliances or equipment installed

questions.question: What Standard must meter and service regulator installations be in accordance with?

Suppose an appliance requires a clearance of 24 inches. By how much can the clearance above the appliance be reduced if the surrounding surface is covered with 28 gauge sheet metal, spaced out 1 inch?

Suppose an appliance requires a clearance of 24 inches. By how much can the clearance at the sides and rear of the appliance be reduced if the surrounding surface is covered with 28 gauge sheet metal, spaced out 1 inch?
In general, what is the minimum service clearance surrounding an appliance?
True or False: A furnace or water heater needs to be certified specifically for use within a mobile home if the home has been placed in a permanent location.
Who is responsible for inspecting and determining whether a used appliance is suitable for continued use?
If there is a conflict between the manufacturer's certified installation instructions and the Codebook, which requirements are to be followed?
What are the minimum dimensions of an access opening to a space containing a gas appliance?
What is the minimum distance an appliance burner may be located from the floor of a repair garage?
What must be done with a defective heat exchanger of a furnace?
True or False: If in compliance with procedures acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction, a defective heat exchanger of a commercial or industrial appliance can be repaired?
What are the controls necessary for two or more appliances with self-energizing pilots?
options: Each installed separately with separate thermostats
Installed with one thermostat to control all of the appliances
questions.correctAnswerText: Each installed separately with separate thermostats

questions.question: Where would you find requirements governing the construction of chimneys?
options: National Energy Code of Canada for Buildings (NECB)

questions.question: What Code would you refer to for information on the electrical circuits of gas-fired equipment?
options: National Energy Code of Canada for Buildings (NECB)

questions.question: Which regulation describes the legal requirements of employers and suppliers of hazardous materials?
Who publishes the standard Installation Requirements for Gas-burning Appliances in Manufactured Homes?
What do the letters 'TSSA' stand for?
What is the title of the Code that deals with propane storage and handling that is currently accepted into law in Ontario?
options: CSA B149.2-15 Propane Storage and Handling Code
CSA B149.1-15 Natural Gas and Propane Installation Code
CAN/CSA-B149.3-15 Code for the Field Approval of Fuel-Related Components on Appliances and Equipment
questions.correctAnswerText: CSA B149.2-15 Propane Storage and Handling Code

questions.question: What legal document is the least specific but contains the most powerful set of rules?
What regulates Manufacturer's instructions?
What do Codes provide?
options: General principles, duties, and responsibilities, as well as define the administrative powers for monitoring, enforcing, and creating regulations
Specific information on materials or components that you can use and how you are to use and test them
General requirements and directions on what can be used and how to use it
questions.correctAnswerText: General requirements and directions on what can be used and how to use it

questions.question: Does TSSA have regulatory authority over the safety of both natural gas and propane?
Are the appliance manufacturer's installation instructions legal documents?
Is TSSA a part of the government?
What allows TSSA to accept and amend codes and standards without a regulatory change?
options: Regulation 223/01 Codes and Standards Adopted by Reference
questions.correctAnswerText: Regulation 223/01 Codes and Standards Adopted by Reference

questions.question: Who does TSSA report to?
options: Ministry of Government and Consumer Services (MGCS)
questions.correctAnswerText: Ministry of Government and Consumer Services (MGCS)

questions.question: Which of the following best describes due diligence?
options: Knowing and Understanding all of the Regulations before working in the industry
Knowing who the local TSSA Inspector is and advising him/her of ongoing work
Actions that are reasonable in the circumstances expected from a reasonable person
questions.correctAnswerText: Actions that are reasonable in the circumstances expected from a reasonable person
